### Content1 ...

<!--
In each section, please describe design decisions made, including:
 - Choice of algorithms
 - Behavioral aspects. What configuration values are acceptable? How are corner cases and error 
    conditions handled, such as when there are insufficient resources?
 - Class organization and design (how the logic is split between classes, inheritance, composition, 
    design patterns)
 - Method organization and design (how the logic is split between methods, parameters and return types)
 - Naming (class, method, API, configuration, HTTP endpoint, names of emitted metrics)
-->

(or naming) decision point and compare the alternatives with the designs that you've implemented 
(or the names you've chosen) to highlight the advantages of the chosen designs and names. -->

(e. g. a "Proposal" issue, any other issue, or a thread in the development mailing list), 
link to that discussion from this PR description and explain what have changed in your final design 
compared to your original proposal or the consensus version in the end of the discussion. 
If something hasn't changed since the original discussion, you can omit a detailed discussion of 
those aspects of the design here, perhaps apart from brief mentioning for the sake of readability 
of this PR description. -->

<!-- Some of the aspects mentioned above may be omitted for simple and small changes. -->

This PR has:
- [ ] been self-reviewed.

- [ ] added documentation for new or modified features or behaviors.
- [ ] added Javadocs for most classes and all non-trivial methods.

- [ ] added unit tests or modified existing tests to cover new code paths, ensuring the threshold 
  for code coverage.
- [ ] added integration tests.
- [ ] been tested in a test IoTDB cluster.

title: [IOTDB-5824] Fix show devices with * cannot display satisfied devices
body: ## Description Currently, in the Analyze phase, if the mnode above the db uses a * wildcard (e.g. sg*), the ConfigNode does not return the partition information properly, resulting in the request not being dispatched to the SchemaRegion. This PR fixes this issue.

  • 5af5d3d fix: Use correct argument order when stringifying flow collection comments (f...
  • See full diff in compare view

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/network/alerts).

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5807]Fix decompression error for aligned series in fast compaction
body:
**Bug Description**
1. If the compression method of the aligned value series is different from that of the time series, an error will be reported when decompressing.
2. If the compression method of the aligned value series is different from that of the time series, the target file will be corrupted.

**Reason**
1. When reading the source file, all value columns share an uncompressor, resulting in decompression failure.
2. The compression method of the time column in the alignment timeseries takes the first value column. If the source file is in the order of s0 s1 s2, and during fast compaction, the read order is s1 s0 s2 and then written to the target file in this order, that is , the time column of the original file is actually compressed according to the s0 method, and the newly written time column is compressed according to the s1 method, so if the compression method of s1 is different from s0, the target file will be corrupted if flushing time page or chunk directly.

**Solution**
1. When reading files, each value column needs to have its own umcompressor.
2. For the alignment timeseries, when writing a new file, the compression method of the time column uses the default snappy; when rewriting the file, the compression method of the time column is consistent with that of the source file

title: [IOTDB-5807]Fix decompression error for aligned series in fast compaction
body:
**Bug Description**
1. If the compression method of the aligned value series is different from that of the time series, an error will be reported when decompressing.
2. If the compression method of the aligned value series is different from that of the time series,  the target file will be corrupted.

**Reason**
1. When reading the source file, all value columns share an uncompressor, resulting in decompression failure.
2. The compression method of the time column in the alignment timeseries takes the first value column. If the source file is in the order of s0 s1 s2, and during fast compaction, the read order is s1 s0 s2 and then written to the target file in this order, that is , the time column of the original file is actually compressed according to the s0 method, and the newly written time column is compressed according to the s1 method, so if the compression method of s1 is different from s0,  the target file will be corrupted if flushing time page or chunk directly.

**Solution**
1. When reading files, each value column needs to have its own umcompressor.
2. For the alignment timeseries, when writing a new file, the compression method of the time column uses the default snappy; when rewriting the file, the compression method of the time column is consistent with that of the source file

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5820] Exception when use PIPE if sender has more than one data dir on different disks
body:
## Description

Solution: When the data directory and syncDir cross the file system, create a temporary directory in the data directory to hold the hard connection.

Note that when dropping the pipe, all dataDirs need to be scanned to clear the temporary directory.

title: [IOTDB-5819] Fix npe when booting net metrics
body: See [IOTDB-5819](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-5819). In general, the files in /sys/class/net are considered to represent a network card, as shown in the figure below. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37140360/234213454-a1a6af9f-b2e4-43fc-8b50-421be9fa91e1.png) However, in some environments, the /sys/class/net folder may also include non-network card files. NetMetrics uses a Map from the name of a network card to the status of a network card, and NPE occurs when the file name of a non-network card is used to get the status of a network card. To fix this bug, we use a `getOrDefault` method instead of `get` method to avoid NPE.

title: [IOTDB-5721][To rel/1.1] Streaming query DataPartition and Schema while loading TsFile
body:
This PR contains:
- Streaming query DataPartition with constraint of TTimePartitionSlotTransmitLimit while loading TsFile.
- Streaming query Schema with constraint of maxLoadingDeviceNumber while loading TsFile.
- Now, you can check loading TsFile progress in datanode log.
  such as: Load TsFile %s Successfully, load process [1/10]
- Optimized the dispatching process in multi-replications cases, TsFile pieces will no longer be serialized multiple times, which means faster loading in multi-replications cases.

title: Support update last cache for data insertion when using template
body:
## Description

Currently, when using template, last cache won't be updated after data insertion since the cache entry hasn't been initialized and cached during schema validation.

Thanks to all related info is present in data insertion plan, we can directly initialize a cache entry and cache the schema and last value.

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5810] Result handle in memory pool is not be cleaned properly
body: When Fragment instance is finished, related source handle and sink channels in memory pool will be all cleaned. However, result handle uses virtual fragment instance, so it can not be cleaned properly.

title: [IOTDB-5808] Refactor RouteBalancer to match LoadManager framework
body:
- Construct RegionRouteCache to match the framework of other caches. Maintained in LoadCache, accessed through LoadManager.
- The auto RegionLeader balancing is now triggered by ClusterStatisticsChangeEvent.
- Adjust the notification of RouteChangeEvent. After a RegionGroup is created, the ConfigNode-leader will not generate RegionLeader and RegionPriority immediately. The ConfigNode-leader only activate this new RegionGroup by insert new RegionGroupCache. The RegionLeader and RegionPriority will be generated and broadcast in next Statistics loop.

title: [IOTDB-5841] Remove duplicate schema template IT
body:

The ```IoTDBSchemaTemplateIT#testInsertRecordsWithTemplate``` is duplicate with ```IoTDBSessionSchemaTemplateIT#testInsertRecordsWithTemplate```.

Remove the ```IoTDBSchemaTemplateIT#testInsertRecordsWithTemplate``` and add standalone mode and schema file mode to IoTDBSessionSchemaTemplateIT.

title: [To rel/1.1]Remove unecessary synchronized on decrementCnt of SinkListener
body:
cherry-picked from 6a8d009

At first, we add synchronized on decrementGet method to avoid concurrent modification on cnt or we may close the shuffleSinkHandle wrongly. However, using AtomicBoolean is enough to ensure that one channel only decrement the cnt once.
Moreover, adding synchronized on decrementGet method could lead to dead lock. Thread A invokes onFinsh of ISinkLitsener and holds the lock of it. Then A tries to lock the corresponding SinkChannel while Thread B invokes close of SinkChannel first and holds the lock of SinkChannel and then try to lock ISinkListener.
So we need to remove the synchonized keyword on decrementGet method.

title: Update Programming-Go-Native-API.md
Update Programming-Go-Native-API.md
Combine DataNodeSchemaCache of Template and Non-Template Scenarios
body:
## Description

Currently, the DataNodeSchemaCache manages the timeseries not using template cache and DataNodeTemplateSchemaCache manages devices using template. It is hard to manage the total cache stats when keeping these separated. 

Combine these two cache.

title: Remove unecessary synchronized on decrementCnt of SinkListener
body:
At first, we add synchronized on decrementGet method to avoid concurrent modification on cnt or we may close the shuffleSinkHandle wrongly. However, using AtomicBoolean is enough to ensure that one channel only decrement the cnt once.
Moreover, adding synchronized on decrementGet method could lead to dead lock. Thread A invokes onFinsh of ISinkLitsener and holds the lock of it. Then A tries to lock the corresponding SinkChannel while Thread B invokes close of SinkChannel first and holds the lock of SinkChannel and then try to lock ISinkListener.
So we need to remove the synchonized keyword on decrementGet method.

title: [IOTDB-5788] Built-in pipe plug-in management mechanism
body:
The following things are done in this PR:

1. support built-in pipe plugins. do_nothing_processor & do_nothing_connector are added as built-in plugins.
2. allow to create / drop the same function multiple times without errors at PipePluginAgent / PipePluginInfo to adapt the retry policy of the Procedure mechanism.
3. allow to drop a function that is not registered on leader config node so that user can have a chance to change the inconsistant registration state over different config / data nodes.
4. fix ci build error: https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/IoTDB/job/IoTDB-pip-new/job/master/173/console

---

1.  Pipe 
2.  PipePluginAgent / PipePluginInfo  procedure 
3.  coordinator coordinator  drop pipe plugin  leader confignode  drop
4.  ci build error: https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/IoTDB/job/IoTDB-pip-new/job/master/173/console

title: Fix NPE when using template and executing select into
body:
## Description


### Problem Description

NPE occurs when executing the following instructions.
``` sql
create schema template t1(s1 int32, s2 int32)

create database root.db

set schema template to root.db

insert into root.db.d1(time, s1, s2) values(1, 1, 1)

select s1, s2 into root.::(t1, t2) from root.db.d1

```

### Cause and Solution

When fetch schema from DataNodeTemplateSchemaCache, there's no measurement existence check before taking the measurement from template, and this causes the NPE. 

Add existence check to fix it.

title: TemplateSchemaCache in schema fetcher
body:
## Description
Previously, `ClusterSchemaFetcher` would create a cache entry for the schema of all measurements, even for those of devices had activated templates, resulting in additional overhead. 

## Solution
This PR introduces a cache `DataNodeTemplateSchemaCache` specifically designed for activated devices, which can speed up access and is well decoupled from the control flow. Specifically, before each schema fetch, the target computation is checked against existing caches; if a match is found, it is returned; otherwise, the schema is accessed from the existing `schemaCache` and further fetched from the remote source if not ever cached. On the other hand, if a schema not stored locally is fetched from the remote source, the `schemaUpdater` will places it in the appropriate cache depends on whether the device has activated template. 

As mentioned above, this mechanism is independent of specific template constraints and can adapt well to future changes.

title: Double-check protect memory-control boundary to avoid concurrent bug
body:
cherry-pick from #9602 
## Description


Currently, the variable allowToCreateNewSeries is not maintained in a thread-safe manner. Use synchronized and double-check to protect it and ensure accuracy.

title: [IOTDB-5720] Fix release processor fail to release memory due to writer-preferred starvation
body:
## Description

We've implemented StampedWriterPreferredLock to enable memory release when a flush task is waiting for write lock. However, the priority is not set when release task try taking a read lock. Fix it.

title: Accelerate count all schema via schema statistic
body:
cherry-pick from #9609 

## Description

When registering timeseries, we usually want to check current registered timeseries num via count timeseries.

Since there's a statistic value recording the total timeseries num, we can directly return such statistic value without traversing the MTree.

title: Resolve quadratic complexity issue when flushing numerous Internal/Entity nodes in SchemaFile
body:
cherry pick from #9631

## Description

During a flush of SchemaFile for numerous Entity/Internal Nodes, a surge in dirty pages occurs due to the pre-allocation mechanism. Retrieval for a suitable SegmentedPage may require a full iteration if each of these pages has too little space spare to accommodate another segment. The quadratic time overhead may appear to be stucked while handling a massive number of child nodes, e.g., 10 million child nodes.

### Solution
An array of LinkedLists has been introduced to index dirty pages into a tiered structure based on their spare size, considering the minimum segment and other step sizes. When a SegmentedPage is marked as dirty, it will be integrated into one of the LinkedLists if its spare size is larger than the minimum segment.

### Further Improvement
Although the size of pageInstCache is constrained by the config file, and the complexity of retrieval from it will not surge like the dirty pages do, there is a performance pitfall if the application frequently writes small amounts of data after reading almost full pages. This will lead to an optimizable full iteration over the pageInstCache. This issue requires a refactor of the cache mechanism or a complete spare page index and should be addressed in future versions.

### Evaluation
After testing, time cost of flushing 11149000 devices under the same db node is about 50s.

title: Fix concurrent state change bug in QueryStateMachine
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16079446/233275850-5357a814-9f03-4636-a339-94aea72c0085.png)

We should use setIf instead of set in StateMachine<T> because we should never change state from one finished to another state.

title: [To rel/1.1] Add backup cluster interfaces
body:
Function description: 
Add configuration item (backupNodeurlsbackupUsernamebackupPassword) to configure the main cluster IP and backup cluster IP, where the main cluster IP is required (can have more than one IP, required) and the backup cluster IP is optional (can have more than one IP, optional)

Function definition: 
1. When the primary cluster is normally connected, the client connects to the primary cluster 
2. When the primary cluster is disconnected, it switches to the backup cluster
3. When the primary cluster is reconnected, it switches to the primary cluster again

Connection example:
`new Session.Builder()
            .nodeUrls(nodeUrls)
            .username("root")
            .password("root")
            .backupNodeUrls(backupNodeUrls)
            .backupUsername("root")
            .backupPassword("root")
            .version(Version.V_1_0)
            .build();`
`new SessionPool.Builder()
            .nodeUrls(nodeUrls)
            .user("root")
            .password("root")
            .backupNodeUrls(backupNodeUrls)
            .backupUser("root")
            .backupPassword("root")
            .maxSize(3)
            .build();`

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5798] Fix concurrent problem when sinkChannel acknowledgeTsBlock() and close()
body: When sinkChannel invokes acknowledgeTsBlock(), bufferRetainedSizeInBytes is reduced first, but free() is not executed within Lock. If close() is called at this time, it will check bufferRetainedSizeInBytes 0 and pass. Then the finished method of fragmentInstance will be invoked, and it will check the memory reserved in memoryPool. But free() is not finished, so it will cause the memory leak exception.

title: [IOTDB-5798] Fix concurrent problem when sinkChannel acknowledgeTsBlock() and close()
body: When sinkChannel invokes acknowledgeTsBlock(), bufferRetainedSizeInBytes is reduced first, but free() is not executed within Lock. If close() is called at this time, it will check bufferRetainedSizeInBytes 0 and pass. Then the finished method of fragmentInstance will be invoked, and it will check the memory reserved in memoryPool. But free() is not finished, so it will cause the memory leak exception.

Release notes

Sourced from jetty-server's releases.

title: [To rel/1.1] Add a cache to avoid initialize duplicated device id object in write process
body:
## Description

In write process, especially write by insertRecords interface, the PartialPath Object of deviceId may init too many times. This PR is adding a DataNodeDevicePathCache to avoid initialize duplicated PartialPath.

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-5797] Load remote TsFile
body:
load statement:
load 'filePath'

filePath option: it supports HTTP style URI now, but it only support transporting by HTTP protocal, and can't recognize .mods file.

title: [IOTDB-5791] Construct Cluster-LoadPublisher-Thread and IClusterStatusSubscriber
body:
New feature in ConfigNode-leader's LoadManager:

- Cluster-LoadPublisher-Thread: publish cluster events
- IClusterStatusSubscriber: subscribe cluster status events

See detailed design at [LoadManager](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnZ2tquzJKINQWi9nnYECPCb)

title: Add a cache to avoid initialize duplicated device id object in write process
body: In write process, especially write by insertRecords interface, the PartialPath Object of deviceId may init too many times. This PR is adding a DataNodeDevicePathCache to avoid initialize duplicated PartialPath.

title: Fix potential Npe of ShuffleSinkHandle
body: isFull() of SinkChannel returns its blocked while this blocked could be null if the SinkChannel is closed before it is opened. We need to check whether the blocked is null.

title: [IOTDB-5735] Fix result of some UDF with align by device is incorrect
body: see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/VRW9dF5XMog9D2xqZMrczjMvnAg

title: [IOTDB-5786] Fix potential deadlock in DriverScheduler
body:
This pr aims to fix potential deadlock in DriverScheduler caused by concurrently calling abortFramentInstance and toAborted.
See https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/KFsvdMwL4orqkCxrdARc37W8nxf for more details.

## Description

title: [To rel/1.1] distinguish whether an exception has occurred when releasing the QueryExecution resource
body:
Optimized query request resource release
1. 
To end a normal operation, run resultHandle.close();
To terminate the exception, run resultHandle.abort().
2.
To end a normal operation, run FragmentInstanceContext.finished();
To terminate the exception,  run FragmentInstanceContext.cancel().
3. 
Reset the stopped flag when retries occur on requests between nodes

title: [IOTDB-5784] Incorrect result when querying with offset push-down and time filter
body:
see IOTDB-5784.

1. Bug fix: When judging whether a file/chunk/page can be skipped based on statistics, the time filter is not considered, resulting in skipping some files/chunks/pages by mistake. I fixed this bug by assigning time filter conditions to `queryFilter`.
2. Add `allSatisfy` interface for `Filter`, when all the points in file/chunk/page  meet the filter, they can be skipped.

title: [To rel/1.1] Fix time partition interval config load bug
body:
## Description

Currently, the config ```time_partition_interval``` is loaded and managed by configNode, while there's useless process of this config on datanode. 

Eliminate the loading process of this config on dataNode.

title: [IOTDB-5782] Handle PipeSubtask busy-wait and Provide offerEvent factor
body:
In this PR, I've done 2 things:
1. Busy-wait Problem: Only if the pendingQueue is not empty and the PipeConnectorSubtask is in running, it is allowed to invoke the `start()` method.
2. Provide `offerEvent` factor in PipeConnectorSubtask for PipeProcessorSubtask to add Event into pendingQueue.

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5762][Metric] add do nothing level(#9615)
body: (cherry picked from commit 935b5106ed1dbbc0641eace92e499120b07a684a)

title: [To rel/1.1] Resolve quadratic complexity issue when flushing numerous Internal/Entity nodes in SchemaFile
body:
## Description
During a flush of `SchemaFile` for numerous Entity/Internal Nodes, a surge in dirty pages occurs due to the pre-allocation mechanism. Retrieval for a suitable `SegmentedPage` may require a full iteration if each of these pages has too little space spare to accommodate another segment. The quadratic time overhead may appear to be stucked while handling a massive number of child nodes, e.g., 10 million child nodes.

## Solution
An array of LinkedLists has been introduced to index dirty pages into a tiered structure based on their spare size, considering the minimum segment and other step sizes. When a `SegmentedPage` is marked as dirty, it will be integrated into one of the LinkedLists if its spare size is larger than the minimum segment.

## Further Improvement
Although the size of `pageInstCache` is constrained by the config file, and the complexity of retrieval from it will not surge like the dirty pages do, there is a performance pitfall if the application frequently writes small amounts of data after reading almost full pages. This will lead to an optimizable full iteration over the `pageInstCache`. This issue requires a refactor of the cache mechanism or a complete spare page index and should be addressed in future versions.

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-2569]Support ZSTD Compression (#9231)

## Description
Add Compression type Zstd.

title: [IOTDB-5779] PipeConnector reuse strategy based on reference count mechanism
body:
In this PR, I've done 3 things:
1. create `PipeSubtaskManager` class to count Pipe Connector reference.
2. convert `PipeTaskStage`'s type from Class to Interface.
3. remove `PipeProcessorRuntimeWrapper` and `PipeConnectorRuntimeWrapper`

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5776]Update memory estimation of cross space compaction
body:
1. Update memory estimation of cross space compaction and make it more accurate.
2. Increase the compaction memory control parameter, allowing users to customize the closing or opening of the compaction memory control.

title: [IOTDB-5776]Update memory estimation of cross space compaction
body:
1. Update memory estimation of cross space compaction and make it more accurate.
2. Increase the compaction memory control parameter, allowing users to customize the closing or opening of the compaction memory control.

title: [To rel/1.1][IOTDB-5719] Move DataNode's checking of SchemaQuota above the consensus layer
body:
## Description

The current DataNode check for SchemaQuota is performed in the SchemaRegion. RatisConsensus expects the state machine to respond identically to the same apply request in the same state. However, in the case of multiple replicas, due to instabilities such as synchronization delays, the SchemaQuotaInfo may be different for different replicas, which may result in different SchemaRegion replicas responding differently to the same apply request (some replicas execute successfully, some replicas throw a QuotaExceededException).

Therefore, this PR moves the DataNode's checking of SchemaQuota above the consensus layer. The checks are performed before the execution plan enters the consensus layer to avoid errors.

The check cases involved are:
1. Creation of a time series
2. Creation of aligned time series
3. Activating metadata templates

title: [TEMP] Update ratis pre-release version to verify CI

2. Increase the compaction memory control parameter, allowing users to customize the closing or opening of the compaction memory control.

title: [DOC][Grafana Plugin] Update the user manual for alerting
body: Adjusting the Grafana plugin user manual

title: [To rel/0.13] change default concurrent_sub_rawQuery_thread and concurrent_query_thread to 0
body:
Previous:
concurrent_sub_rawQuery_thread is 8, we use the min(concurrent_sub_rawQuery_thread, cpu cores) as sub query thread.
concurrent_query_thread is 16, we use the min(concurrent_query_thread, cpu cores) as concurrent query thread.

Problem: When users use a machine with cpu cores larger than 8 and 16, the default query thread will be limited to 8 and 16.

Currently:
concurrent_sub_rawQuery_thread is 0, default is cpu cores, but users could change it, which could exceeds the cpu cores.
concurrent_query_thread is 0, default is cpu cores, but users could change it, which could exceeds the cpu cores.

If uses' cpu core is lower than 8, the upgrade has no effect.
If uses' cpu core is larger than 8, the concurrent_sub_rawQuery_thread will be larger(cpu cores).
If uses' cpu core is larger than 16, the concurrent_query_thread will be larger(cpu cores).

The class provides `consume` factor for PipeProcessorStage to accept processed Event and add it to pendingQueue.

title: Optimize update last cache lock granularity
